Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: This guide will connect Business Central to your shop on Shopify. We'll create a new shop in Business Central, and help you import data you may already have on Shopify.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: While you're using a demo company, we want to keep things safe for your Shopify store. You can use this guide to import up to 25 products from Shopify, but you can't export Business Central data to your store.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: We found your shop on Shopify

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: We found this URL for your shop on Shopify. You can use the URL for another shop if you want.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Enter the URL for your shop on Shopify

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: The URL must refer to the internal shop location at myshopify.com. It must not be the public URL that customers use, such as myshop.com.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the URL of the Shopify Admin you are connecting to. Use the format: "https://{store ID}.myshopify.com". You can build the URL by combining the store ID from the admin URL, e.g., "admin.shopify.com/store/{store ID}" and ".myshopify.com". Simply copy the URL from the Shopify Admin, and the connector will convert it to the required format. Ensure you copy the URL from the Shopify Admin, not the online store, as the online store may display a redirect URL.

Properties.Name: Tooltip
Properties.Value: Indicates that the administrator user could not sign-in to Shopify.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: When you choose Next you'll be asked to sign in to your Shopify account and request access to your Shopify shop.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Get started with Business Central by importing data from Shopify

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: This guide can help you quickly get started with Business Central. You can import the products and customers from Shopify that you want to manage in Business Central. You can use this guide only one time

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Sorry, we can't import your data.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: You already have items in Business Central. Review the settings for your shop to ensure that your Shopify products map correctly to Business Central items, and then manually import your products.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Products in Shopify are called items in Business Central. This guide can help you import your Shopify products to Business Central. You can use this guide only one time.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the item template to use when creating items in Business Central. These are products in Shopify that don't exist as items in Business Central.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Here are the important settings for getting started.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: You've chosen to import customers. Here are some important settings that define how to create them in Business Central.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the customer template to use to create unknown customers. These are customers in Shopify that don't already exist in Business Central.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: You should only import customers for whom you want to track order activity in Business Central. For example, the customers that you often do business with.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Specify how orders should be created

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Orders that you synch from Shopify can automatically become sales orders in Business Central (recommended). The item quantities on these orders are then part of inventory planning and availability in Business Central. You can also import orders to the Shopify Orders page and then turn them into sales orders manually.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether to automatically create orders.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the G/L account to use for shipping costs from Shopify.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Additionally, choose the G/L account to use for shipping costs from Shopify.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: We've already started importing products from your shop in Shopify.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Review your shop settings to ensure that data synchronize correctly.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: We've already started to import data from your shop in Shopify.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: The connection to your shop is working.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Review your shop settings to ensure that your data synchronize correctly.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the name of the entity that was imported.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the status of the import job.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether the session is active.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies a code to identify this Shopify Shop.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: Give your shop a name that will make it easy to find in Business Central. For example, a name might reflect what a shop sells, such as Furniture or Coffee, or the country or region it serves.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the URL of the Shopify Admin you are connecting to. Use the format: "https://{store ID}.myshopify.com". You can build the URL by combining the store ID from the admin URL, e.g., "admin.shopify.com/store/{store ID}" and ".myshopify.com". Simply copy the URL from the Shopify Admin, and the connector will convert it to the required format. Ensure you copy the URL from the Shopify Admin, not the online store, as the online store may display a redirect URL.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: Provide the URL that people will use to access your shop. For example, *https://myshop.myshopify.com*.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies if the service is enabled.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: We just need the shop name and URL to connect it to Shopify. When you have checked all shop settings, enable the connection here.

Properties.Name: ToolTip

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the currency of the Shopify Shop. Enter a currency code only if your online shop uses a different currency than the local currency (LCY). The specified currency must have exchange rates configured. If your online shop uses the same currency as Business Central, leave the field empty.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
